messages.message: Hi folks, not sure if this has been brought up before. Whenever we hit an error on ai-hub, likely we get redirected to a page from the "old" UI that has apps/file explorer icons on the left bar. Apparently the page style is very different from ai-hub, and I think this may make users feel disconnected when errors happen. I think ideally we should redirect to a dedicated page that has the consistent ai-hub UI for errors.
That’s true, this will expose a bunch of pages and apps we don’t want aihub users to know about. Can we make a new error page? @Jessica maybe?

I think this happens when api-server/webapp handler throws an exception that got uncaught in the handler, the decorator wrapper caught it ultimately and lands users on this page. So to make this change, we need to make the error page "pluggable" - for non-aihub environment we have the default error page and for aihub ones we have another.
